informal_statement: Suppose that $g(x)=f^{-1}(x)$. If $g(-15)=0$, $g(0)=3$, $g(3)=9$ and $g(9)=20$, what is $f(f(9))$? Show that it is 0.
informal_proof: Since $f$ and $g$ are inverses and $g(3) = 9$, we have $f(9) = 3$, so $f(f(9)) = f(3)$. Similarly, $g(0) = 3$, so $f(3) = 0$.
formal_statement:
theorem mathd_algebra_451:
  fixes \<sigma>:: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "bij \<sigma>"
    and "Hilbert_Choice.inv \<sigma> (-15) = 0"
    and "Hilbert_Choice.inv \<sigma> 0 = 3"
    and "Hilbert_Choice.inv \<sigma> 3 = 9"
    and "Hilbert_Choice.inv \<sigma> 9 = 20" 
  shows "\<sigma> (\<sigma> 9) = 0"
formal_code:
(*
  Authors: Wenda Li
*)

theory mathd_algebra_451 
  imports Complex_Main "HOL-Computational_Algebra.Computational_Algebra"
begin

theorem mathd_algebra_451:
  fixes \<sigma>:: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "bij \<sigma>"
    and "Hilbert_Choice.inv \<sigma> (-15) = 0"
    and "Hilbert_Choice.inv \<sigma> 0 = 3"
    and "Hilbert_Choice.inv \<sigma> 3 = 9"
    and "Hilbert_Choice.inv \<sigma> 9 = 20" 
  shows "\<sigma> (\<sigma> 9) = 0"
  sorry

end
